wmisc 0.2.18.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Nice correlation matrix

    nice_corrmatrix.Rd

    From a psych corr object it gives a correlation matrix formatted for overview

    nice_corrmatrix(
  cr,
  upper = FALSE,
  lower = TRUE,
  digits = 2,
  values = TRUE,
  stars = TRUE,
  numbered_columns = TRUE,
  descriptives = TRUE,
  labels = NULL,
  ci = FALSE,
  nsig_p = 0.1,
  char_nsig,
  char_autocor = "-",
  char_p10 = "✝",
  char_NA = "",
  caption = "Correlation matrix.",
  drop_zero = TRUE,
  type = "df",
  ...
)

    Arguments

    cr

    A data frame or a correlation matrix returned by the psych package

    upper

    TRUE if upper triangle should be included.

    lower

    TRUE if lower triangle should be included.

    digits

    Round to given digit position.

    values

    TRUE if values should be included.

    stars

    TRUE if stars should be included.

    labels

    Character string. If "auto" labels are taken from a label attribute.

    nsig_p

    p level below which correlations are considered not significant.

    char_nsig

    Character indexing non-significant values.

    char_autocor

    Character for diagonal (e.g. "-" or "1.00").

    char_p10

    Character indexing .10 significance level.

    char_NA

    Character for NA values.

    caption

    Caption for a html table.

    type

    Character string. "df" for data-frame. "html" for html table (needs knitr and kableExtra packages).

    ...

    Further arguments passed to the [psych::corr.test()] function.

    Value

    A data-frame or a html table object

    Examples

    nice_corrmatrix(mtcars, type = "html", ci = TRUE)
